TopicTitle: Long-term Laythe Mission (pic heavy) - ^_^ With Part 45 ^_^

Articles.Content: The Bill9000 is just a little part that lets you attach MechJeb to a ship. The part looks like a HAL 9000 interface, so it's amusing. It's not any better than sticking on a standard MechJeb part, or using that mod that adds MechJeb to all capsules (or whateverÃ¢â‚¬Â¦I never used that), or whatever people do. It's just that I started attaching MechJeb to my ships long ago using the Jeb9000 part (later became the Bill9000) at the recommendation of a friend, so I have that part on ships and probes all over the Kerbol system after 26 yearsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦so I keep using it. I don't know that the part has been properly updated for version 0.23Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ I had to edit its config file or something back in 0.22 (can't recall exactly what the deal was now). It certainly needs to be installed in the old way of installing parts.

"Go play outside."

That got me a few odd looks on the bus.

As epic as always.

Cool. And is Nelemy now the official Snack Hunter of Laythe Base?

(Travels of Thompbles... testing the 3-seat BirdDog?)

The Bill9000 is just a little part that lets you attach MechJeb to a ship.

Oh, I must have miss-remembered. I thought Bill9000 was an addition to existing capsules, adding mechjeb to all the stock ones without needing the AR202 (or whatever the standard Mechjeb unit is called) itself on a vessel.

Fenomenal. all the details and the size of mission. BIG

Congrats.
Wow, this thread is big, and it's great, so you're stickied for this month Brotoro
Congratulations on thread of the month! Well deserved.
Congratulations Brotoro But...why only a month? This thread deserves to be permanent sticky.

I feel all sticky.

Thank you.
Yay! Good work!
Congrats on getting Stickied!
It's about time! Brotoro certainly deserves all the stickiness he can get!
Congrats ... ! This is the biggest and most impressive mission I've seen yet in KSP ... !

The Bill9000 is just a little part that lets you attach MechJeb to a ship. The part looks like a HAL 9000 interface, so it's amusing.

Actually it looks like SAL 9000. Bill 9000 and SAL 9000 have a blue eye, while HAL 9000 and Jeb 9000 have a red eye.

Actually it looks like SAL 9000. Bill 9000 and SAL 9000 have a blue eye, while HAL 9000 and Jeb 9000 have a red eye.

Jeb 9000 actually has a Green Eye.
You people and your color vision.
Sorry! I forgot you were colorblind.
I'm sorry, Dave, I'm afraid I can't see that.
Congrats for being the thread of the month, brotoro! I hope this happens again soon!
You know, for some reason I always read your name(brotoro) like "bro-toro-brotoro!" As in Totoro.

You know, for some reason I always read your name(brotoro) like "bro-toro-brotoro!" As in Totoro.

You are correct. It is intended to rhyme with Totoro (the forest spirit from the Hayao Miyazaki anime My Neighbor Totoro, for any of you who are mystified as to what we are talking about).

I see. Awesome!
